top: The Pacific island of New Caledonia will hold its second vote on Sunday on whether to declare independence from France, amid fears that the territory of 271,000 is falling increasingly into China’s orbit.
New Caledonia has rejected an independence referendum which would have led it to cut ties with France.
New Caledonia became a French colony in 1853.

New Caledonia rejects full independence: As head of state, I salute this show of confidence in the Republic with a profound feeling of gratitude,” Macron said in a televised statement.
“We have two years to look to the future,” the president continued.
New Caledonia holds independence poll as: José Sousa-Santos, a senior associate in Pacific Regional Security at Victoria University of Wellington said there were serious concerns about the economic implications of leaving France, which provides the island with $1.5 billion a year in funding.
China is New Caledonia's largest trading partner.
New Caledonia votes to reject independen: The vote was the final step of a process that started 30 years ago following years of violence between the two groups.
The Kanaks had once suffered from strict segregation policies and the vote comes at a time when the legacy of colonialism is under scrutiny across the world.
